OrderSubsystem

Class OrderCollectionJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • OrderSubsystem.OrderCollectionJDBC

  • public class OrderCollectionJDBC
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the JDBC Class for the Order management subsystem This class provides the queries for the following methods (use cases) -createOrder -cancelOrder -shipOrder -viewOrderHIstory
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    James McCarthy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OrderCollectionJDBC()
      Constructor that establishes the connection to the mySql server through JDBC and the private variables declared above.

      Closes the connection for the JDBC in case they haven't been closes already

      Inserts the Order created by the User into the DB Orders table with all the attributes and values entered by the User
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Order> getAllOrderQuery()
      For Client Use** Similar to the Order History Query however this one takes no parms because it returns all of the Orders in the DB for display to the Client.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrdersProductsQuery

        public java.util.LinkedList<ProductManagementSystem.Product> getOrdersProductsQuery(int orderId)

      • orderHistQuery

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Order> orderHistQuery(java.lang.String accountIdIn)
        Creates the Order History HashMap that will be used to fill the OrderHistory Display for the User when looking at past Orders they have made. The HashMap is filled by a select query with the accountId = "the users account ID" conditional to find the Orders in the DB only associated with that AccountID.
        Parameters:
        accountId - - the Id used by the User
        Returns:
        hMap - Hash map that has all Orders Made by User

      • getAllOrderQuery

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Order> getAllOrderQuery()
        For Client Use** Similar to the Order History Query however this one takes no parms because it returns all of the Orders in the DB for display to the Client.
        Returns:
        HashMap with all the Orders extracted from the DB.

      • searchOrderQuery

        public Order searchOrderQuery(java.lang.String orderIdIn)

      • shipOrderQuery

        public boolean shipOrderQuery(java.lang.String orderId)
        **For Client Use** Takes the OrderId searches for it in the DB, than alters the OrderStatus column to shipped.
        Parameters:
        OrderId - - The Unique ID of the Order to be shipped.
        Returns:
        True or False - if the operation was successful or not

      • cancelOrderQuery

        public boolean cancelOrderQuery(java.lang.String orderId)
        Takes the ORder ID searches for it in the DB, than alters the order status column to Cancelled.
        Parameters:
        OrderId - - the Unique Id of the Order
        Returns:
        True or False - If operation was successful or not

      • removeOrderQuery

        public Order removeOrderQuery(java.lang.String orderId)
        Used by the Admin (Client) to remove cancelled orders from the Database that no longer need to be seen or used in the System.
        Parameters:
        orderId - - Id of the order to be removed.
        Returns:
        Order - returns the ORder that was deleted null - order never existed.

      • createOrderQuery

        public boolean createOrderQuery(Order order)
        Inserts the Order created by the User into the DB Orders table with all the attributes and values entered by the User
        Parameters:
        order - - The Order to be inserted into the DB
        Returns:
        true or false -if the operation was Successful

      • closeConnection

        public boolean closeConnection()

        Closes the connection for the JDBC in case they haven't been closes already

        Returns:
        True or False- If operation is successful
